snippet: The Survivors Network of those Abused by Priests said broad subpoenas in two Missouri sex-abuse cases were a means of intimidation, an accusation the church disputed.
abstract: Survivors Network of those Abused by Priests has been subpoenaed five times in recent months, and believes that the legal action is part of a campaign by the Catholic Church to cripple the organization, which has been the most visible defender of victims, and a relentless adversary for more than two decades; says it has spent about $50,000 and hundreds of hours of staff time since the subpoenas began, and is seeking lawyers who will work pro bono.
lead_paragraph: The Survivors Network of those Abused by Priests said broad subpoenas in two Missouri sex-abuse cases were a means of intimidation, an accusation the church disputed.

headline.seo: Catholic Church Puts Legal Pressure on Survivors’ Network
headline.main: Church Puts Legal Pressure on Abuse Victims’ Group
headline.print_headline: Church Using Priests’ Cases To Pressure Victims’ Network
